newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan stocks end down on position squaring.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan stocks end down on position squaring.

text.p: Pakistani stocks finished lower on Friday as investors, who were unsure of market direction, squared their positions before the Saturday-Sunday weekend, dealers said.
Most investors are likely to remain cautious ahead of the budget for fiscal 1997/98 (July-June) expected to be announced on June 14, a dealer at Fortune Securities said.
The Karachi Stock Exchange 100-share index fell 12.39 points, or 0.80 percent, to close at 1,535.28 at 0720 GMT.
ICI Pakistan fell 0.25 to 24.30 rupees and Pakistan State Oil 6.50 to 311.50.-- Ovais Subhani 9221-5685192
